column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0125] Successful dispersal occurs when a portion of the deposited or dispensed product subsequently coats a portion of the target surface where the substance was not originally deposited.
#Text=Upon removal of the sheet material from the target surface, at least some of the substance remains located on the target surface, preferably in a substantially-uniform fashion.
#Text=[0126] The mitts of the present invention may be packaged in any suitable fashion.
#Text=However, one method of packaging the mitts involves tri-folding them in a C-folded configuration, then stacking a plurality of folded mitts within an outer carton or wrapper.
#Text=It is believed that the "cushioning" effect of the superposed folded portions of the mitts provides additional protection against premature rupture of the fluid reservoirs.
#Text=[0127] The mitts of the present invention may also allow users to clean without the usual concerns associated with conventional spray and wipe products.
#Text=One such concern relates to the potential for irritation and/or inhalation of volatile chemicals.
#Text=Most spray or aerosol cleaners include one or more volatile organic solvents, or propellants, which can cause irritation to the nose or skin.
#Text=The architecture of the product form of the present invention may reduce or eliminate this problem.

#Text=Lack of spraying also means greater efficiency in the use of the product, and avoidance of product reaching surfaces, such as wood or clear plastic panels, that are adjacent to or nearby a target surface and may be sensitive to a particular product composition such as a product including organic solvents.
#Text=Lack of spraying may further reduce or eliminate streaks due to a sprayed product not being properly buffed.
#Text=In particular, the mitts can eliminate or reduce performance and surface safety issues that may result from product runoff.
#Text=Users may also benefit from not having to store or carry multiple products just to undertake a particular cleaning task.
#Text=Additionally, judicious selection of substrate raw materials for the mitts can maximize the cleaning benefit.
#Text=As such, the user is prevented or discouraged from using inappropriate combinations of substrate and cleaning composition for a particular cleaning task.
#Text=Finally, by combining the product form and cleaning composition in one, the user saves time.
#Text=[0128] The mitts of the present invention have multiple possible methods of use.
#Text=In one embodiment, the mitts are folded so as to protect the product reservoir from pressure.
#Text=Users may conveniently remove the mitts from a container, unfold the mitt and fit one of their hands through the mitt aperture.
#Text=The reservoir pouch can be actuated to release the product.
#Text=This can be achieved by any suitable method such as pressing on the reservoir pouch with one or more fingers, with the palm of the free hand, or by pressing the pouch against a solid surface.

#Text=The amount dosed can be controlled by instructing the user to press the reservoir pouch so as to release an amount of fluid consistent with parameters that are either printed on the instructions for use, or written or graphically illustrated directly on the front panel 24 side of the mitt.
#Text=In a particular embodiment, instructions for use call for releasing fluid so as to wick an area that is demarcated around the orifice from which the fluid is drawn.
#Text=The area to be wicked can be shown by means of any graphical representation or in words.
#Text=In a preferred embodiment, the area to be wicked is shown via a circle or other geometric figure.
#Text=The size of the geometric figure can reflect the optimum composition volume for the task at hand, and will be a function of the substrate raw material, wicking ability and basis weight.
#Text=In most cases, the geometric figure may be a circle having a diameter from about 1 centimeter to about 15 centimeters, more preferably from about 2 centimeters to about 8 centimeters.
#Text=Those skilled in the art will recognize that the mitts can be designed so that liquid preferentially wicks in one direction versus another direction.
#Text=In such instances, for example, the graphical demarcation on the mitt can preferably consist of one or more noncircular geometric figures.
#Text=[0129] In the event that mitts are used without the benefit of the attached dosing reservoir, the two-sided mitt can be used together with a conventional spray bottle.
#Text=While this is not a preferred mode of use, some of the benefits stemming from the choice of absorbent and non-absorbent substrates are still retained.

#Text=Accordingly, the methods for use will be similar to those described above, substituting the preferred dosing mechanism from the reservoir with an equivalent or slightly larger volume e.g., 1.0 to 1.5 times of cleaning composition delivered from the spray bottle.
